Text: In 2022, reported emissions from large industrial sources were approximately 5% lower than in 2021..
Between 1990 and 2023, annual emissions of SO2 from power plants fell by 45% and annual emissions of NOX from power plants fell by 50%.
Compared to 2022, the 2023 data show a 25% decrease in NOX emissions, a 15% decrease in SO2 emissions, and a 30% decrease in mercury emissions..
Reported power plant emissions increased dramatically in 2021
There is an decrease in emmisions as nations switch to coal
Power plants should not reduce SO2 and mercury as it increases CO2 emissions
